newsitem.title: FINLAND: Finnish Dec C/A surplus FIM 1.2 bln - Cen bank.
newsitem.headline: Finnish Dec C/A surplus FIM 1.2 bln - Cen bank.

text.p: The Bank of Finland said on Friday its estimate for the December trade balance was a 1.0 billion markka surplus compared to a revised 6.1 billion markka surplus in November.
Based on the trade balance estimate, Finland's current account would show a 1.2 billion markka surplus in December after a 3.8 billion markka surplus in November, the central bank said.
It gave the following figures (billion markka):
The trade balance estimate is based on a survey of firms accounting for about 70 percent of Finland's foreign trade.
The central bank's preliminary trade figures are subject to revision later by the National Customs Board when official foreign trade data is gathered.

The central bank's survey was started in January 1995 to enable the Bank of Finland to release other components of the current account despite the delay in official trade Statistics following Finnish membership of the European Union at the start of 1995.
